section.title: The syntax of access rules
section.para: An access rule of JPA Security always starts with GRANT READ ACCESS TO, followed by the entity name (according to the JPA Specification, defaults to the class name if not otherwise specified) and an alias for that entity.

The GRANT clause is optionally followed by a WHERE clause, thats syntax is derived from the syntax of WHERE clauses of JPQL, the query language of JPA. Within the WHERE clause there are two special input parameters that may be used, which are :user and :roles. The :user parameters will be evaluated to the currently authenticated user during runtime and the :roles parameter will be expanded to a list of roles that the current user belongs to. No other input parameters may be used in the WHERE clause of access rules.
